column4: Got some wireless problems ;< I got usb wifi asus 167g. It is recognised in ubuntu and I can see my wifi network. But I cannot connect to it. NetworkManager shows me 2 wireless connecections (wmaster0, wlan0). I tried to configure both of them - didn't help. Well, I tried rt73 drivers, ndiswrapper, wifi-radar and still no result :(
Can someone help me? ^_^
Is the WiFi network encrypted?
nope
i turned everything off
Does the Access Point have MAC-authorisation running?
nope :<

If the PC can see an open network but can't connect, the only things I can think of are 1) the WAP is operating at a fixed speed that the client can't connect at (unlikely), or you've got radio interference from other devices in the 2.4GHz band
well, I'm connected to this wifi network right now. Just using windows, not ubuntu. So the problem is in the software =|
Hmmm, that does sound like a driver issue. Are you using NDISwrapper or native linux drivers?
well I tried both. NDISwrapper driver tells me smth. like no hardware installed. Native linux drivers do see the device but I cannot connect using them.
I'd contact the maintainers of the linux drivers with the details of your hardware then
is there any way to install linux driver avoiding terminal (I'm allways getting errors when using it)? Any GUI like ndisgtk.
unless its part of an update, you usually need to run the installer from a terminal. You need to use sudo so the installer has super-user privileges to install drivers.
d'oh!
What've you done? :)
'you usually need to run the installer from a terminal' =|
Well, you asked about GUI installers...!
Isn't edubuntu also aimed at 'thin clients' ?

I mean it's a bit hard for me to compile the drivers and so on :) I't allways the main trouble for me when I try to switch to linux. I cannot configure my wifi -> no internet -> no point in using OS without internet :)
Ahhh, I see. Does the PC not have a wired connection you could use temporarily?
nooooo ;<
